poem:
Gaza Morning

Among canned goods  
and lined faces—cries  
echo. Thick stillness,  
like bread rationed, crumbles  
beneath boots.  
Sky's raw glare reveals  
a language of hunger  
whispered in shadows,  
unheard beyond fences.  
Here, the ground  
mourns  
between silenced steps—  
children clutching hope,  
thin as dust, sift  
through ashes for dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "At least 37 Palestinians killed in Gaza food site shooting, local authorities say At least 37 Palestinians were killed on Monday in new shootings in Gaza near food distribution centres run by private US contractors guarded by Israeli troops, local authorities said. Witnesses blamed the shootings on Israeli troops who opened fire early in the morning in an effort to control crowds of hungry Palestinians converging on two aid hubs managed by the Gaza Humanitarian". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: At least 37 Palestinians killed in Gaza food site shooting, local authorities say At least 37 Palestinians were killed on Monday in new shootings in Gaza near food distribution centres run by private US contractors guarded by Israeli troops, local authorities said. Witnesses blamed the shootings on Israeli troops who opened fire early in the morning in an effort to control crowds of hungry Palestinians converging on two aid hubs managed by the Gaza Humanitarian
